alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harrison and east central Hancock Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Lyman, or 10 miles northeast of Diamondhead, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lyman. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 20 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
